SEARCH
Package edu.baylor.GroupFive.database.controllers

Class AccountController

java.lang.Object
edu.baylor.GroupFive.database.controllers.AccountController
public class AccountController extends Object
This class represents a handler between our UI layer and our application layer. Methods from this class are called from our UI layer. AccountController then determines which Service object in our application layer to continue operations with. The status of each operation is then returned to the UI layer.
Author:
Brendon, Icko

  • Method Details

    • login

      public static User login(String username, String password) throws InvalidCredentialsException
      Takes in a username a password and attempts to log in the user. This function calls LoginService.login(String,String).
      Parameters:
      username - Users username
      password - Users password
      Returns:
      User object associated with correct username and password
      Throws:
      InvalidCredentialsException - If invalid credentials are provided
      See Also:
      • LoginService.login(String, String)

    • getUser

      public static User getUser(String username)
      Fetches a user from our database given a username. This function calls AccountService.getUser(String).
      Parameters:
      username - Users username
      Returns:
      User associated with username
      See Also:
      • AccountService.getUser(String)

    • register

      public static boolean register(User user)
      Takes in a user objects and registers them for an account. This function calls AccountService.register(User).
      Parameters:
      user - User to register
      Returns:
      true if saved successfully. false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • AccountService.register(User)

    • checkAccountExists

      public static boolean checkAccountExists(String username)
      Takes in a String username and checks if an account with this username exists in our database. This function calls AccountService.checkAccountExists(String).
      Parameters:
      username - Users username
      Returns:
      true if account with that username exists. false otherwise
      See Also:
      • AccountService.checkAccountExists(String)

    • modifyAccount

      public static Boolean modifyAccount(User user)
      Takes in a new User object and updates the account information. This function calls AccountService.modifyAccount(User)
      Parameters:
      user - User with modifications
      Returns:
      true if account was successfully modified. false otherwise
      See Also:
      • AccountService.modifyAccount(User)
